intro: Diplusodon thymifolius, commonly known as the thyme-leaved dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that develop into fluffy, white seed heads. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grassland habitats. Diplusodon thymifolius is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
